Word.Root: To play sport in a frivolous manner, busy in trifles, wasting time in vain or sport or play, nonsense, useless.

Meaning.Definition: عَبَثَ aor. يَعْبِثُ inf. noun عَبْثٌ عَبَثَ الشَّىْءَ بِالشَّىْءِ: He mixed or mingled one thing with another. عَبِثَ (aor. يَعْبَثُ inf. noun عَبَثٌ ) : He played or sported or amused himself; he mingled together unprofitable actions; he did what was useless and unprofitable. فَعَلَ ذٰلِكَ عَبَثًا : He did that profitlessly; he did what was of no use to him. عَبَثَ بِهِ الدَّهْرُ : Fortune made sport with him.
Meaning.Example: Token(23:116:2:4) That We have created you in vain or without purpose (23:116).
Token(26:129:1:5) Do you build on every height a monument seeking vain glory? (You do a useless thing) (26:129).
